projectGridLines.stationName: J-PAL & Health Department, Government of Andhra Pradesh
projectGridLines.title: Climate and Health Analysis for the Government of Andhra Pradesh
projectGridLines.description:
Description: 

Due to the untimely nature of the rains in the last 2 years, the health department has seen an unusual surge in several infectious diseases such as malaria, dengue, etc, in the months of February and March (especially in the Tribal Agency areas). The epidemiological data is available to the department. The department will assist in coordinating with the Meteorological department, the Rural Water Supply department, and other departments to collect necessary data for further analysis. The project would involve analyzing this data, generating patterns, and creating critical decision support systems for the State Government.

kill sets: 

  • Ability to work with large and diverse datasets in climate and health
  • Well-versed with data cleaning, sorting, and reporting tools like Excel, Tableau, SQL, etc
  • Advanced statistical analysis
  • Data visualization
  • Proficiency with R, Python, or any other statistical programming languages


Traits expectation: 

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
  • Good verbal, written, and presentation skills


Expected learning:

  • Immersive opportunity to apply data science to real-world problem statements in the field of climate change and health 
  • Hands-on experience of engaging with senior government officials to learn the institutional complexities and decision-making process in policymaking


Specific courses required for project execution: 

  • Any advanced statistics/data science course
